value: Attacks and Spells are more likely to be Critical Hits.
Taking Damage gives you more Rage.
When below a certain threshold of Health your Health Regeneration is triggered. This Effect has a Cooldown.
Physical, Toxic and Rend damage is increased. You cannot inflict other Damage Types.
Increased Damage for each Enemy within Melee Range.
Give all forms of damage Life Leech. Life Leech heals you on the next tick of Health Regeneration.
The more Rage you have, the more Damage you deal. This applies to all Damage Types.
A percentage of Physical Damage becomes Rend Damage.
Blocking a Hit provides you and your Allies with an increased All Resistances Score Buff.
Each point of Physical Resistance increases the Damage you deal with all Damage Types, but decreases your Critical Chance Score.
Benefit from Block Chance with any Weapon equipped
Blocking an Enemy's attack inflicts them with Weakness.
Health Globes will now provide a temporary Buff to your Resistances as well as Healing you.
Your Attack and Spell Casting Speed is increased.
Gain additional Stamina Points while at low Health. This Effect has a Cooldown.
Increases your Passive Dodge Chance Score
A percentage of Physical Damage is converted into Toxic Damage.
Active Dodges can go through Enemies.
Deal increased Damage when only one Enemy is Nearby.
Dash Attacks have an increased Chance to be Critical Hits.
Your Critical Damage is increased, but your Damage is decreased.
Projectiles that Hit an Enemy at close range Pierce them, meaning that the Projectile can Hit other Enemies behind them.
Enemies that have Impaired Movement (Slowed, in Stasis, Stunned or Frozen) take increased Damage.
Attacks and Spells that launch Projectiles now launch an additional Projectile. The Damage of each Projectile is decreased.
Deal increased Damage when Far-Away from Enemies.
Enemies take increased Damage from your Projectiles, the Damage scaling (up to a limit) with their distance away from where you launched the Projectile.
Increases your Ailment Chance Score with all Ailments
Health Globes now restore your Force Shield as well as your Health.
When your Force Shield is full, you receive decreased Damage.
When inflicting Ailments, the number of Stacks inflicted on an Enemy is increased. The Damage you deal from sources other than those that deal damage-over-time is decreased.
Ailment Stacks inflicted with Critical Hits can deal Critical Damage.
Hits can usually only apply one ailment type. Now 2 different ailments can be applied with the same hit.
When inflicting an Ailment, there is a Chance to double the number of Ailment Stacks inflicted.
Killing an enemy that is afflicted with Ailments gives you a temporary Damage increase Buff.
Casting a Spell increases the Damage of your Attacks for a short period of time. The Damage Type of those Attacks is the same as the last Spell Cast.
Your Spell Critical Chance Score is increased when your Willpower is above a certain threshold.
When you are afflicted with damage over time, ailment damage affects your Force Shield before your Health.
Dealing Damage will now allow you to recharge Force Shield instead of restoring Health with Life Leech.
When you Damage an Enemy that is afflicted with Stasis, they will take the Damage again after a few seconds.

If you inflict Stasis on an enemy with an Attack, you gain a "Supernatural Paradox" point. Each point of "Supernatural Paradox" increases your Spell Casting Speed Score.\n\nIf you inflict Stasis on an enemy with a Spell, you gain an "Earthly Paradox" point. Each point of "Earthly Paradox" increases your Attack Speed Score.
A portion of the Damage you receive is delayed, and this delayed Damage does not interrupt Force Shield Regeneration.\n\nYour Maximum Health and Force Shield is decreased.
The Occult damage that an Enemy receives from your Attacks is increased with each Curse stack they are afflicted with.

Every Ailment that Stacks which you inflict is also inflicted on you. Each time you reach 10 Stacks of one Ailment Type, that Ailment Type is removed completely, giving you and your Allies a Buff for a short time depending on which Ailment type is removed.

If Stasis Stacks were removed, Movement Speed is increased.

If Curse Stacks were removed, All Resistances Score is increased.

If Weakness Stacks were removed, Damage is increased.

If any other stacks were removed, Health and Force Shield are regenerated.
Maximum Force Shield is doubled.\n\nYour Health cannot exceed 5% of your Maximum Force Shield.
Damage is increased based on how much Pierce is remaining on a Projectile after it has Hit an Enemy.
When a Projectile Hits an Enemy, it will bounce off them and hit another enemy, dealing increased Frost Damage. Projectiles will not bounce if they have Pierce remaining.
Every second that you are in combat you receive "Cold Blooded" points that increase your Damage. If you are Hit the "Cold Blooded" points are removed.

You will receive a Buff depending on which archetype your equipped Chest-piece belongs to.

If you have a Bruiser Chest-piece, you receive Health Regeneration for each Health point on the Armor.

If you have a Heavy Chest-piece, its All Resistances Score is doubled.

If you have a Rogue Chest-piece, you regenerate Health and Force Shield each time you complete a Passive Dodge. The amount that you regenerate is determined by the Health points given by the Armor.

If you have a Sorcerer Chest-piece you regenerate Force Shield based on the amount of Force Shield on the Armor.
Every few seconds you gain a "Fortress" point up to a Maximum. Each "Fortress" point increases your Block Chance. "Fortress" points are removed when a Block is completed.

While stationary you gain an "Inexorable" point every few seconds. Each point of "Inexorable" decreases your Movement Speed and increases your Damage. Moving will cause an "Inexorable" point to be removed after a few seconds.
Whenever you Active Dodge, enemies in your path receive Damage and a Decoy is left at the starting position of the Active Dodge.

You have 5 "Lure of Darkness" points and 5 "Lure of Light" points. When using a Spell you gain 1 "Lure of Darkness" point and lose 1 "Lure of Light" point. When using an Attack you gain 1 "Lure of Light" point and lose 1 "Lure of Darkness" point. When both points are weighted 6/4, they are considered to be in Equilibrium. While in this state, you will receive the following Buffs:

A percentage of your Attack Damage is added to your Spell Damage.

A percentage of your Spell Damage is added to your Attack Damage.
Whenever you complete an Active Dodge, you become Invisible and your next Attack deals increased Shadow damage.

After a few seconds of not being Hit, you gain a "Tenet" point. When you are Hit you ignore a percentage of the Damage and lose a "Tenet" point. The amount of Damage not dealt is increased with each point you have.

You have 5 "Annointed Ammunition" points that replenish every few seconds. "Annointed Ammunition" also replenishes  when you complete an Active Dodge.

For every "Annointed Ammunition" point you have, your Projectile Damage is increased.

For every "Annointed Ammunition" point you have missing, your Melee Damage is increased.

Every time you kill a Champion enemy, you gain 1 "Headhunter" point up to a Maximum. Each "Headhunter" point increases your Material Damage for a few seconds. Your "Headhunter" points will be reset if you do not aquire a new point within a given timeframe.
Enemies are killed instantly if Hit while their Health is below a certain threshold. This only works on Underling and Specialist enemies.

When your Health is below a certain threshold, you make a "Prayer", giving a Buff to the All Resistances Score of your Allies for a few seconds and reviving Downed Allies. This Effect has a large cooldown.

When your Force Shield is above a certain percentage, your Spells that deal Sacred Damage deal increased Damage.

When your Force Shield is below a certain threshold, your Attacks that deal Sacred Damage deal increased Damage.

This ability only works if your Force Shield is above 0.

Using Skills that deal Elemental Damage you their corresponding "Accord". Each Accord has different Effects depending on its Elemental Damage Type.

"Beelmalik's Accord" increases your Critical Chance Score for a few seconds.

"Abanazaar's Accord" increases your Damage for a few seconds.

"Etheliel's Accord" increases your Ailment Chance Score for a few seconds.
Allows you to have two "Accords" active at any time.

Whenever your Willpower is below a certain percentage, each time you use a Skill there is a Chance that you will cause an explosion. You and Enemies take a percentage of your maximum Health OR Force Shield (whichever is highest) as Damage, and a percentage of your Willpower is regenerated.\n\nThe Damage type of the Damage dealt is selected randomly between Lightning, Fire, and Frost.

Certain Skills that deal Elemental Damage Types have a chance to launch other Spells when Cast.

Lightning Skills can launch a Chain Lightning Spell.

Fire skills can launch a Meteor Spell.

Frost skills can launch a Frost Lance Spell.
Enemies that die near you have a chance to drop a Green Globe. If picked up, the Globe will increase your Toxic damage for a short duration. This Buff Stacks with each Globe picked up.
Summons that die near you also drop a green globe.
Enemies receive a Stack of Poison every few seconds when they are close to you.
Your Maximum Health and Force Shield is decreased, but your Summons receive decreased Damage.

You unlock the "Probing Weakness" and "Stalwart Resolve" Stances, each one giving you different Buffs. Using an Active Dodge changes your Stance.

While in the "Probing Weakness" Stance, your All Resistances Score is decreased, but your Basic Attacks have a chance to deal double Damage, including on Critical Hits.

While in the "Stalwart Resolve" Stance, your Attack and Spell Casting Speed Score is decreased, but your Block Chance is increased.
If you Block an Enemyâ€™s attack, you instantly deal a percentage of your Weapon Damage in a counter-attack.

Completing Basic Attacks with the same Weapon 4 times within a short period grants you different Buffs depending on the Weapon.

One-handed and dual-wielded Weapons always inflict Critical Hits on the 4th Basic Attack.

Two-handed axes, hammers, and swords always inflict Stun in an area of effect on the 4th Basic Attack.

Bows always launch Projectiles in 360 degrees around you on the 4th Basic Attack.

Staffs always launch multiple Projectiles on the 4th Basic Attack.
Your Willpower generated is transferred into Rage.\n\nYour Willpower Regeneration is also applied to Rage instead.
If your Rage is above a certain threshold, your skills deal twice their damage, but cost more to use.
When you Hit an Enemy that has a certain number of Burn Stacks, your Hits have a Chance to consume the Burn Stacks that you inflicted and deal increased Damage per the number of Stacks consumed.
Each time you Hit an Enemy, you receive an "Unleashed Fury" point. Each "Unleashed Fury" point increases your Attack Speed Score, your Life Leech, and decreases your All Resistances Score.

Each time you use a Basic Attack, you receive an "Overload" point that increases your Damage. When you use a Skill, every "Overload" point is removed and the total Damage Buff provided by your "Overload" points is doubled.
Whenever you inflict a Critical Hit on an Enemy, your Attack Speed Score is increased for a short duration.

You have "Power Charge" points. This resource is now used to activate any Device Skills or Skills that deal the Lightning Damage Type. The resource can have any value between -100 and 100. When Power Charge is a positive number, your Damage will be increased, and when it is a negative number, your Damage will be decreased.

Power Charge is regenerated over time, and by using your Basic Attacks.

These Skills still consume their dedicated Resource in addition to "Power Charge".
Increased Chance to inflict all Ailment types on enemies
Each Headhunter point grants a Material damage bonus
Chance for Attacks to deal double Damage while losing All Resistances
Increased Block Chance and Block Efficiency at the cost of reduced Attack and Spellcasting Speed
